verses.verse: Even <WH1571> to day <WH3117> is my complaint <WH7879> bitter: <WH4805> my stroke <WH3027> is heavier <WH3513> than <WH5921> my groaning. <WH585>
Oh that I knew <WH3045> where I might find <WH4672> him! that I might come <WH935> even to his seat! <WH8499>
I would order <WH6186> my cause <WH4941> before <WH6440> him, and fill <WH4390> my mouth <WH6310> with arguments. <WH8433>
I would know <WH3045> the words <WH4405> which he would answer <WH6030> me, and understand <WH995> what <WH4100> he would say <WH559> to me.
Will he plead <WH7378> against <WH5978> me with his great <WH7227> power? <WH3581> No; <WH3808> but he would put <WH7760> strength in me.
There <WH8033> the righteous <WH3477> might dispute <WH3198> with him; so should I be delivered <WH6403> for ever <WH5331> from my judge. <WH8199>
Behold, <WH2005> I go <WH1980> forward, <WH6924> but he is not there; and backward, <WH268> but I cannot <WH3808> perceive <WH995> him:

On the left <WH8040> hand, <WH8040> where he does work, <WH6213> but I cannot <WH3808> behold <WH2372> him: he hides <WH5848> himself <WH5315> on the right <WH3225> hand, <WH3225> that I cannot <WH3808> see <WH7200> him:
But he knows <WH3045> the way <WH1870> that I take: <WH5978> when he has tried <WH974> me, I shall come <WH3318> forth <WH3318> as gold. <WH2091>
My foot <WH7272> has held <WH270> his steps, <WH838> his way <WH1870> have I kept, <WH8104> and not declined. <WH5186>

Neither <WH3808> have I gone <WH4185> back <WH4185> from the commandment <WH4687> of his lips; <WH8193> I have esteemed <WH6845> the words <WH561> of his mouth <WH6310> more than my necessary <WH2706> food.
But he is in one <WH259> mind, and who <WH4310> can turn <WH7725> him? and what his soul <WH5315> desires, <WH183> even that he does. <WH6213>
For he performes <WH7999> the thing that is appointed <WH2706> for me: and many <WH7227> such <WH2007> things are with him.
Therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> am I troubled <WH926> at his presence: <WH6440> when I consider, <WH995> I am afraid <WH6342> of him.
For God <WH410> makes my heart <WH3820> soft, <WH7401> and the Almighty <WH7706> troubles <WH926> me:
Because <WH3588> I was not cut <WH6789> off before <WH6440> the darkness, <WH2822> neither has he covered <WH3680> the darkness <WH652> from my face. <WH6440>
